originalText.text: Carlos is an excellent barber, never was so satisfied with my haircuts. He always listens carefully to what I'm looking for and never disappoints. Also love the vibes and atmosphere, always great music playing when you walk in! Best barber shop in NYC ðŸ’¯

text.text: Carlos is an excellent barber, never was so satisfied with my haircuts. He always listens carefully to what I'm looking for and never disappoints. Also love the vibes and atmosphere, always great music playing when you walk in! Best barber shop in NYC ðŸ’¯

originalText.text: Good prices, owner is super nice. Maybe not a place for Asian hair as I asked for a low/medium fade and even showed a picture but was given a high fade/undercut. It has taken me months to grow the hair on my parietal ridge only for it to be all removed in an instant... I didn't notice during the haircut as I wasn't wearing my glasses. At the end of the haircut I was asked when my previous haircut was, a question that should be asked at the beginning of a cut. When I responded 2-3 weeks, the barber responded "oh I'm surprised because that was a lot of length taken off". He also mentioned that for Asians, they should either keep the sides very short or grow their hair out so it felt to me that he already had a gameplan without really paying attention to what I wanted. I'm not the type to write negative reviews, especially for small businesses, but it really has sucked looking at the mirror these past few weeks. I would've felt even more strongly had I went in closer to Christmas. Hopefully this can be taken as constructive criticism.

I am being permanent here! Thanks guy!

originalText.text: I have lived in Hells Kitchen for over 7 years and bounced between barbershops never finding a great spot. Carlos isnâ€™t just a  phenomenal barber he is an awesome guy. Super professional, amazing at his craft, and an intellectual. I always look forward to chatting with him when I get my hair cut. Absolutely recommend to friends and coworkers all the time.
